language.name: Gabri
language.area: Tandjilé region, Tandjilé Est Department, Laï Subprefecture, northwest of Laï, Dormon and Darbé villages area.

language.name: Gulay
language.area: Moyen-Chari (6 cantons), Logone Oriental (1 canton), and Tandjilé (1 canton) regions, between Koumra, Laï, and Doba.

language.name: Kera
language.area: Mayo-Kebbi Est region, Mont d’Illi Department, south of Fianga, near Lake Tikem. Also in Cameroon.

language.name: Pévé
language.area: Southwest near Cameroon border, Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Lamé home of Chef de Canton, and administrative center. Also in Cameroon.

language.name: Marba
language.area: Tandjilé region, Tandjilé Ouest Department, north of Kélo.

language.name: Musey
language.area: Mayo-Kebbi Est region, Kabbia and Mont d’Illi departments (Gounou Gaya, Fianga) and Tandjilé region, Tandjile Ouest Department (Kélo). Gounou Gaya is commercial and administrative center. Also in Cameroon.

language.name: Mundang
language.area: Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Lac Léré and Mayo-Dallah departments (Léré, Pala), Mayo Kebbi Est region, Mont d’Illi Department (Fianga). Also in Cameroon.

language.name: Sar
language.area: Moyen-Chari and Mandoul regions, Sarh, Koumra, Balimba, Bessada, Bédaya, Djoli, Matékaga, and Koumogo cantons.

language.name: Mbay
language.area: Mandoul region, Barh Sara Department; around Moïssala. The traditional area is on the border of Chad and Central African Republic. Also in Central African Republic, Nigeria.

language.name: Nancere
language.area: Tandjilé region, Tandjile Ouest Department, Béré, Delban, and Kélo subprefectures.

bibles.title_vernacular: Runa min wavaray ra ke ena ra

language.name: Ngete
language.area: Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Mayo-Dallah Department, east of Pala, Ngeté village area; near the Pévé [lme], east of Herdé [hed].

bibles.title: The Common Language Ngambai Version
bibles.description:
The first Bible in Ngambai

A Common Language translation. With preface, chapter and section headings, text in double column format, inter-Gospel references, references, illustrations by Horace Knowles, glossary, maps

The Old Testament translated by Doreen Barrie, (Mission Évangélique d'Ubangi), Elie Reookilia Reouwai (Église Évangélique du Togo) and nationals Moise Méro, Bongembai and Ngakaibe
bibles.description_vernacular: Mânnro ge Leou qe Mânnro Ge Cigi

language.name: Ngambay
language.area: Logone Occidental region; Logone Oriental region, Lanya Department (Bébedjia), La Nya Pendé Department, Goré Subprefecture; Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Mayo-Dallah Department. Centered in Moundou area. Also in Cameroon, Nigeria.

language.name: Chadian Arabic
language.area: Salamat, Ouaddaï, Wadi Fira regions, Batha region center and west, much of Chari-Baguirmi; Mayo-Kebbi; north Tandjilé; Guéra. Also in Cameroon, Central African Republic, Niger, Nigeria.

country.name: Chad
country.introduction: Chad part of France's African holdings until 1960 endured three decades of civil warfare as well as invasions by Libya before peace was restored in 1990. The government eventually drafted a democratic constitution and held flawed presidential elections in 1996 and 2001. In 1998 a rebellion broke out in northern Chad which has sporadically flared up despite several peace agreements between the government and insurgents. In June 2005 President Idriss DEBY held a referendum successfully removing constitutional term limits and won another controversial election in 2006. Sporadic rebel campaigns continued throughout 2006 and 2007. The capital experienced a significant insurrection in early 2008 but has had no significant rebel threats since then in part due to Chad's 2010 rapprochement with Sudan which previously used Chadian rebels as proxies. In late 2015 the government imposed a state of emergency in the Lake Chad region following multiple attacks by the terrorist group Boko Haram throughout the year; Boko Haram also launched several bombings in N'Djamena in mid-2015. DEBY in 2011 was reelected to his fourth term in an election that international observers described as proceeding without incident. In January 2014 Chad began a two-year rotation on the UN Security Council.
country.overview: Chad officially the Republic of Chad is a landlocked country in Central Africa. It is bordered by Libya to the north Sudan to the east the Central African Republic to the south Cameroon and Nigeria to the southwest and Niger to the west.
